title: Helena Bonham Cater reveals her uncle dated Princess Margaret who she plays in The Crown
text:
Mark Bonham Carter went on to serve as Liberal MP for Torrington, Devon. He is brother to Helena Bonham Carter's father Raymond. (Helena Bonham Carter attends the Save The Children: Centenary Gala at The Roundhouse on May 09, in London)

Helena Bonham Carter, who plays Princess Margaret Netflix series The Crown, has revealed a real-life connection between her uncle and her on-screen character.

The actress, 53, said former Liberal MP, Mark Bonham Carter dated the Princess when he was a Grenadier Guard in Windsor and was guarding Princess Margaret and Princess Elizabeth.

'They always remained good friends. I have photos of them together and they look really dashing as a couple,' Ms Bonham Carter said.

Speaking at the Cheltenham Literature Festival she added that it felt strange playing the part of Princess Margaret, 'It's weird, I basically went out with my uncle.'

Mark Bonham Carter was the son of Sir Maurice Bonham Carter and his wife, Lady Violet Asquith, daughter of the Liberal Prime Minister H. H. Asquith.

His brother, Raymond Henry Bonham Carter, is father to Helena Bonham Carter.

He was educated at Balliol College, Oxford and was commissioned in the Grenadier Guards in November 1941.

He was reportedly captured in Tunisia in 1943 and imprisoned in Italy, from where he escaped.

After finishing the last year of his degree at Oxford, Bonham Carter went into publishing, working for Collins.

He married Leslie Nast, the younger daughter of American magazine publisher Condé Nast and the former wife of Peter George Grenfell, 2nd Baron St Just in 1955.

Together they had three daughters.

The actress, 53, said former Liberal MP, Mark Bonham Carter dated the Princess (pictured together above) when he was a Grenadier Guard in Windsor and was guarding Princess Margaret and Princess Elizabeth

Bonham went on to serve as Liberal MP for Torrington, Devon. He was made a life peer in 1986 and named Baron Bonham Carter.

He also held a number of prominent positions. He was vice-chairman and governor of the BBC between 1975 and 1989 and director of the Royal Opera House for 24 years.

He died in Bussento, Italy on 4 September 1994.

Helena Bonham Carter, who plays Princess Margaret in The Crown, (above) revealed the real life connection between her uncle and her on-screen character while speaking at the Cheltenham Literature Festival

Princess Margaret married Antony ­Armstrong-Jones, made Earl of Snowdon by the Queen in 1960. They divorced in 1978.

It's not the first close association Ms Bonham Carter has claimed to have had with Princess Margaret. She also revealed at the literature festival how she had consulted a psychic before taking on the role and how that led to the actress speaking with the princess herself.

Ms Bonham Carter said she'd asked Princess Margaret if she was OK with her playing the part.

'You're better than the other actress' … that they were thinking of... But you're going to have to brush up and be more groomed and neater.'

Ms Bonham Carter added that Princess Margaret had said that she would have to get the smoking right if she played the part.
description: Mark Bonham Carter 'dated' the Princess when he was a Grenadier Guard. Helena Bonham Carter said her uncle and the princess remained good friends following the relationship.
